author: timbeiko
content: <@!301186049323958275> it came up yesterday on my Peep an EIP call that 1559 should be moved to "In Review". Is that right? If so, does it require an author to make the PR to it?

author: sky.cactus
content: Probably not until we update with 2718 I think.

author: sky.cactus
content: Review means "authors don't think there are any additional changes to be made", but we *do* have pending changes.

author: timbeiko
content: Ahh, got it üëç

author: timbeiko
content: That's a good point then, once we have the 2718 dependency baked in, I think it makes sense to move it. The only other thing that _may_ change is the update rule, but that may also just not happen.

author: sky.cactus
content: Just give me the green light and I can update with 2718.  üôÇ

author: sky.cactus
content: We have been waiting for reasons, so I haven't drafted the PR.

author: sky.cactus
content: Though, that discussion will *probably* involve SSZ.  üò¨

author: timbeiko
content: I think we still want to run the large state testnets first. It's a _bit_ more complicated than expected to get the smart contract storage up to mainnet size, but I think we're on the way there üòÖ

author: sky.cactus
content: We may want to start *talking* about the SSZ problem, to get a headstart.

author: timbeiko
content: Anyways, we're starting to drift away from this channel's topic üòÖ. We can maybe discuss SSZ on the implementers' call tomorrow?

author: sky.cactus
content: What time is that meeting?

author: timbeiko
content: The bad time for you üòÖ 16:00 UTC.
